title: What are the best books on the history of New York? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Gotham, by Burrows and Wallace, is generally thought of as one of the most comprehensive histories. Gotham: A History of New York City to 1898: Edwin G. Burrows, Mike Wallace: 9780195140491: Amazon.com: Books The Power Broker, by Robert Caro, details the life of Robert Moses who played an outsize role in the transformation of New York City in the 20th Century, and consequently there’s a lot of history in there. The Power Broker: Robert Moses and the Fall of New York by Robert A. Caro (1974-07-12): Amazon.com: Books I really like The Big Oyster by Mark Kurlansky. Mark is a “food historian” (my term) and this book is about the oysters that were once more plentiful in New York harbor than anywhere else in the world. But even though it’s about oysters, it ends up being quite an informative history of New York in the second half of the 19th Century. The Big Oyster: Mark Kurlansky: 9780224078238: Amazon.com: Books Finally, I have a book called the Historical Atlas of New York City. I love it, and reference it all the time. The Historical Atlas of New York City, Third Edition: A Visual Celebration of 400 Years of New York City's History: Eric Homberger: 9781250098061: Amazon.com: Books
